website_summaries.verdict: These magnetic locks will help you keep your cabinets and drawers off-limits to kids.
pros: Locks can be installed on the inside of cabinets and drawers, keeping them out of sight
Magnetic key used to open the locks is easy to store high up and out of a child's reach
Locks are simple to disengage at any time
cons: Deliver limited strength in comparison to other locks

customer_reviews.title: New Design Does not work once installed
customer_reviews.text: We received a set of 4 of these as a gift, and they work great for us. We are both mechanically inclined, so we didn't need the template to install them, and they hold great and line up great. We decided to order more, for the rest of our cabinets. However, this set doesn't work at all. The magnet unlocks it just fine, until it is actually installed. Our cabinets are not at all thick--they are old, crappy cabinets. Just disappointed that the older set worked great, but they must have changed the design just enough that they don't work now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Giese

customer_reviews.title: Works well for both drawers and cupboards
customer_reviews.text: We've used these in two houses, and they are super consistent. The only failure we've seen is when they are over-tightened and the screw holes are slightly out of position. When that happens, the flipper will get stuck down--just loosen the screws a small amount to relieve the stress. This is a design flaw, and hasn't been fixed in 5+ years as I just bought a recent set, so that is why this isn't a 5-star. The design causes the mechanism to stick if the holes aren't perfect, and who with a small kiddo has time to make them perfect?!? Otherwise, i highly recommend, just would like to see products improve with time.
customer_reviews.author: GLo

customer_reviews.title: Locks Cabinet Doors Securely
customer_reviews.text: The locks seem to hold the doors to my kitchen cabinets securely closed. And the magnetic keys work to unlock the locks through the thickest part of the cabinet doors (probably about 1/2 inch of solid wood). However, even with the provided template, they were not particularly easy to install. Alignment was a little more difficult than I thought it needed to be, resulting in a few extra holes on the (not visible from the outside) inside of the cabinet. I should have measured 3 times, not just twice, before drilling.
customer_reviews.author: MBT

customer_reviews.title: The product works great until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Well, at first I was very pleased with the product as the installation isn't hard and there is no learning curve for using it, however after a while, I noticed that the glue holding the static piece to the cabin or draw is starting to fail, and it's enough for one corner to be weak and the entire thing doesn't hold up to a child pressure. I tried using super glue but it didn't do the trick, if you are willing to use nails I guess it can be firmly attached, but that wasn't an option for me so I stopped using this product.
customer_reviews.author: BTW

customer_reviews.title: Product is great, installation template is not
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but the installation template is horrible. Previously they had a paper template that you could reuse a few times which is helpful when you're installing several locks. However, the template included in this kit is one time use only so heaven forbid you stick it into the wrong spot. Additionally, the adhesive on side 1B is strong...so strong you can't easily peel off the paper to expose it which is really frustrating when the template comes off when your trying to peel off the paper. Tip, peel off a corner on 1B and fold it in on itself so it's easier to remove during install. Again, the product is great but the template included is not.
customer_reviews.author: True2ThySelf

customer_reviews.title: Great for IKEA Billy bookcase/cabinets
customer_reviews.text: See my video for a more detailed review. Easy to install on IKEA billy bookcase cabinets using the template provided. Just make sure you see where the doors are closing before putting the catch on. On regular cabinet doors without glass panels these would be even easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: clsteldt

customer_reviews.title: At first they worked fine and then I started to notice that randomly my ...
customer_reviews.text: Total junk! I bought these for my kitchen cabinets and they only took a few minutes to install on all of my lower cabinets. At first they worked fine and then I started to notice that randomly my daughter would just be able to open the cabinets with the lock engaged. Now they've been installed a month and two (out of eight) don't lock at all. Luckily these cabinets don't contain anything poisonous inside of them! I will be going tomorrow to get new child locks and will throw these in the trash. Do not waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: PeggyE

customer_reviews.title: Very Secure. Even for adults.
customer_reviews.text: When we first moved into our houses few of these were installed and we didn’t know how they worked and we literally spent hours trying to get into our cabinets. Didn’t know what the white plastic thing was and almost tossed it. FINALLY figured it out and now we love them and installed them everywhere else in our house. The toddler loves playing with the magnet and it’s too big to swallow. Installation was a little tricky but honestly my husband and threw out the instructions so I guessed my way through it so probably easier to install than my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel MacPherson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had minor issues with mounting. I had to move the mounting location over a little bit as the corners of the cabinets have metal insert in the wood that would trigger the magnet. The magnet is very strong and easily works through 1.25" of wood and can easily work through 1.5" of wood. From my messing with it, it can probably reach another 0.25". The most frustrating part is forgetting that it is on there as well as having to find a good spot to keep the key so you don't lose it! Worked good enough that I bought a second one for the upstairs bathroom too.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Koehl

customer_reviews.title: After putting these in we don't even understand why we wasted our time with the cheaper alternatives
customer_reviews.text: We hesitated purchasing these locks for a long time and tried other cheap plastic alternatives. After putting these in we don't even understand why we wasted our time with the cheaper alternatives! I didn't have any problems installing these on the cabinets BUT I guess for the way our drawers were built, we weren't able to use them for our drawers. At first it was a bit hard to remember to use the locks but after a few days we got the hang of it. We put the lock on one of the top cabinets' corners. This way we have a less chance of losing it among all of the chaos.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but great baby proof locking system
customer_reviews.text: So besides the fact that it does take a while to install, I really like these magnetic baby proof locks in our kitchen cabinets. It keeps our 16 month old from opening the cabinets without anything on the outside of the cabinet appearing as if though it's baby proofed. It's a little pricey especially since we had to get 2 packages and you do have to drill into the cabinet, but if your on your first child and plan to have more- these are great. Just don't lose the magnet to open the cabinets ( we stick ours in the fridge) .
customer_reviews.author: Gabby W.

customer_reviews.title: Duce proof!!!
customer_reviews.text: He ran through a couple of products similar. Popping the plastic ones right through. But this magnet's to much for my lil'warrior-king... He doesn't even pay the drawers any attention anymore. Though he has notice we put the magnet key on the door to unlock it. So I would advise keeping it out of reach. As well as buying a back up key. Or we did for the cabinets upstairs. As they come with plenty of locks but only 1 key. But Luv the product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Wright

customer_reviews.title: Buy these NOW!
customer_reviews.text: We had a set of these with our first child. Then when we moved to a new house, I ended up having twins. To save money, I got the kind of cabinet latches that open a little and you push down the little lever to open. Big mistake! I could hear banging all day and night when the twin toddlers figured out that they could open and slam the doors over and over. I bought these to replace them. They are super easy to install, and if done correctly, the cabinets don't open at all. The twins don't even try to touch them now. And this mama has QUIET again... kind of...
customer_reviews.author: Lea1235

customer_reviews.title: Best child safety lock
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best child safety locks we have found. They are extremely easy to use. I love that you can switch them into the "off" position if you are constantly opening the drawer (for example while cooking). I haven't found them here in Europe, but they are so good that I paid for the shipping from Amazon US. They are that good. One tip: if you are having a hard time finding the correct spot, hold the magnet loosely. It will be pulled to the right spot. Also on occasion if you pull and it doesn't open, try pushing a bit then pulling.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install! Keeps animals out!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, i purchased these to keep my fat cat from helping herself to the food cabinet...but my sister used this in her house and they worked for her 2 kids...I’m used to them, so wanted to stick with the same brand etc. The instructions were clear and the template was very clever! I’m moderately handy and had no trouble installing at all. Full disclosure, i did use the tip from another review and bought #6 sheet metal screws and washers. I cant say it made a difference either way, but i am also one to take advice. These function exactly as promised, much to the fat cat’s dismay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about these sooner!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these after trying and hating another brand of crappy plastic safety locks for our drawers and cabinets. I wish I had known about these from the beginning! We've been using them for about 15 months now and they keep our kids out of the drawers in our kitchen. I love that there is the option to turn the lock on or off by toggling the grey button. It's super convenient if you need to rearrange drawers (we have a drawer that is just for kid dishes & utensils)! I'd definitely buy again and I recommend these to all of my friends!
customer_reviews.author: NurseK

customer_reviews.title: Best safety for base cabinets. None compare!
customer_reviews.text: The best. We tried others, but finally I had to dig back to find exactly which brand we had purchased initially because others just didn't compare. Yes, they require a little work to install, and may be confusing for the first couple you install... But NO toddler (or adult usually) can open my cupboards without the magnet. The best, and we recently bought more.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Work great and seem to have been improved
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to childproof as other family member use them and everyone's familiar with their operation. I can't be sure, but it seems that the magnet in this newer key is stronger than in the units from 5 years ago. We have no problems opening drawers and doors, and don't seem to hunt for the sweet-spot like the old units. Install was very easy with the included template.
customer_reviews.author: UFeng

customer_reviews.title: I love the feature where you can engage or disengage the lock - great for Grandma’s house for that reason
customer_reviews.text: Install took some getting used to, but I appreciate the templates they provide. Overall, we LOVE that we can engage or disengage the lock. This enables us to keep these locks on our cabinets forever. When our daughter stopped needing locks, we disengaged them and then re-engaged them when our 2nd child starting crawling. We also love how low profile they are. I might buy a set for my parents and in laws so we can engage them when we are visiting, but they don’t need to deal with the baby proofing when we aren’t visiting. Definitely the best cabinet baby proofing locks out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: New installation template!
customer_reviews.text: New template for installation is what made me give this 5 stars. I ordered this product about 2 years ago and the directions for installation and template were jibberish at best. Recently moved and needed new locking system for my cabinets and went back to what I knew. I was EXTREMELY pleased that the new template makes installing these easy. I installed 8 of these on all the kitchen cabinets in less than an hour. Thank you Safety 1st for listening to your customers and finally making the installation user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have use these in two different houses for two different children. Very easy to use and in style. You don’t even need the attached installing guide. You can’t see them at all when cabinets are closed and they can be easily removed when children grow or if you sell a home and it only leaves two small screw holes on the inside of the cabinet. Are usually stick the magnet on the top of the sink or hand towel holder out of reach of the toddler and it works great! I’ve recommended them to many people especially with new homes
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Great childlock option!
customer_reviews.text: Our house had these when we moved in. One broke and we had to replace it (we were having help for a few weeks after a new baby... someone may have pulled too hard or something?). I love them, love them! They don't ruin your cabinets. They work great, you just have to get use to using the magnet and keeping it always in the same place. When you don't need the cabinets locked anymore, then you just flip the switch and you don't have to uninstall anything. They are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea J

customer_reviews.title: Great safety device so you don’t see all the locks!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my kitchen to keep her away from chemicals and the dishes, and in her dresser to make sure she doesn’t play dress up at nap time and all night! They are super easy to install with the included cardboard template and have worked for over a year, hassle free! I ordered more for my family to use!
customer_reviews.author: Ezra Burns

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely essential
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Easy to install. They are very easy to turn on and off, and are the perfect solution to locking up stuff to protect our young grandson when he visits and easily convert to not locking when he's left us. These are a HUGE improvement over the locking system we used 30 years ago when our sons were growing up. The old ones were removed a long time ago because they were so inconvenient. These you can leave installed permanently, then turn them on and off as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C. Rydberg

customer_reviews.title: KEEPS YOUR TODDLERS OUT!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works wonders in keeping toddlers away from anything you value. We have twin 2 yo girls and 3 yo boy. THEY RUIN EVERYTHING!! With all of them tuging on the knobs to open they still couldnt get them to budge. On the random times you leave the 1 magnet they supply in the cupboard... an adult can tug them open at the risk of breaking cabnets. I suggest getting second magnet as i havent found another one that works to open them.
customer_reviews.author: Joeyc

customer_reviews.title: I like that the doors don't open at all
customer_reviews.text: Install is the challenge, but myan took care of it. I just had to listen to the complaining. But it was worth it. The magnet locks are so strong. I like that the doors don't open at all, as with traditional cabinet locks. So babys fingers don't get caught. And there's an easy "unlock" toggle for cabinets I need to get too regularly when cooking. I especially like when other adults come.over and try to open cabinets. The struggle is real.
customer_reviews.author: N.B.

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: We put these throughout the kitchen 5 years ago. They worked great and we really liked the feature to leave them unlocked as the kids got older. Now we have another child and had the first of them fail.. after 5 years. That's pretty good for out of 8 locks, the first one is starting to fail after 5 years. We will be replacing the old ones with new ones and hope they also last 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best option for child-proofing cabinets that I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure my son's going to figure out how to open these, but that would be a problem with anything. My 16m old Houdini took the child proofing off the door to the basement and brought it to me to let me know, too. Having said that, these are great, and I feel just a little like I'm in Ocean's Eleven every time I go to get Clorox Wipes out now. I like that they don't let the door swing two or three inches open like conventional child proofing does. They seal *tight* if you measure right. Great product, plan on using them in lots of places around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was terrible
customer_reviews.text: The sticky guides that make alignment easy didn't work at all. I couldn't remove the cover from the sticky pad which made the easy installation guides useless. Trying to install this in the precise location needed without using the guides is hard. There's a chance I got a bad batch because I went to babies R Us and got some that look just like this with guides that actually worked. I gave it a 1 star review because the caption for 1 star is "I hate it" and there is no better description of how I felt while I was trying to install this without the sticky guides.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hamric

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating installation!
customer_reviews.text: These were so frustrating to use that I bypassed opening the second pack I purchased and went with locks that didn't require tools or screws for installation. The stickers are imperative to the process but one side of the tape was impossible to peel off. I went through 5 of these before finally just giving up and estimating the location of the locks instead, which resulted in 2 damaged cabinets. I managed to get through 2 hours and 3 (successful) cabinets before giving up and buying something else. Also, 1 of the latches was completely defective. This was a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Want to keep the little ones out of cabinets and drawers; then buy this product
customer_reviews.text: First one was a little difficult to install; remainder was a breeze after I got the hang of it. Strong holding power on cabinet doors; enough to keep an autistic adult out of where he shouldn't be. Don't expect perfection though; pull hard enough and any lock will fail. These however do the job they were intended for. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Ray

customer_reviews.title: But these are wonderful for a solution that is invisible from the outside
customer_reviews.text: Our 70's wood cabinets are styled in such a way that most locks won't work. These have worked for us with a little creativity -- in some cases using strong glue instead of screws (if a child pulls really hard you may have to reglue!) or small additional blocks of wood pre-attached to the cabinets. But these are wonderful for a solution that is invisible from the outside, easy to keep unlocked when desired, and durable. Even the ones attached with glue that pulled off eventually did not break. Ours have been working well for 6 or so months now.
customer_reviews.author: aheartforhome

customer_reviews.title: Safe and secure
customer_reviews.text: These are FANTASTIC. Our kid is one of those "smart" kids that figures everything out after seeing it once or twice. These have been on the cabinets for about two months now and she hasn't figured them out yet. Cabinets and drawers are secure, kid is safe (she sure had a fixation on the magic bullet blender). The best part is that there's no fidgeting, no squeezing fingers into it... nothing. AND they have an off switch. If the kid is asleep and I'm re-arranging stuff in the kitchen or putting away dishes, I can leave them unlocked and not have to worry about it. Now I need to find one that works on the dishwasher...
customer_reviews.author: yamichi

customer_reviews.title: Safety Last.
customer_reviews.text: I've never been more annoyed with a "safety" product in my life. The screws included with this product are so cheap that the heads break off when installing causing a MAJOR HEADACHE and a choking hazard if you can't find all of the missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: themartinbirds

customer_reviews.title: Great safeguard for the kiddos!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to keep kiddos out of cabinets, at least the ones that are off limits! Installation can be frustrating, but take your time, it gets easier after the first one or two. Keeps the cabinet doors tight, flush on the frame, unlike the rattling noise makers that hold thru the handles. They create a game called "Where's the magnetic key?" It can be frustrating always having to have the key to get in a cabinet. We learned that from the previous house where all cabinets were locked. Forget that! Just the cabinets with chemicals, glassware, appliances....and the booze! And agree on THE HOME BASE for the key. Makes life easier!
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Works great -- Horrible to install with the screws they provide (super cheap screws whose head keeps on breaking off)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this a 5 star review. As a locking mechanism to keep kids out the product works great. I'm giving this a 3 star review because Safety 1st is including super cheap and crappy screws with the product. In the three magnetic locks I installed today 6 screws broke off at the head due to the super cheap quality of product included. It's all fine and dandy until you realize that once the body of the screw is in the wood you have to uninstall everything you've done so far in order to find a new area that doesn't have the body of the screw in it.
customer_reviews.author: tigerlilies

customer_reviews.title: My kid is very Determined, and still couldn't get in.
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately what sold me and my husband for getting these locks in particular was the video they had of the young child crying when they couldn't get the cabinet door open. We both laughed until it hurt because it reminded us so much of our son, so we got them. And it was picture perfect, he cried and whined and cried and couldn't get the cabinets open no matter how hard he stuck his fat little fingers along the sides looking for some nook or niche to pry it open and, it was, for once, just like in the videos! 15/10 good job guys
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These come with a template that makes installation easy. We prefer these over any other types we have bought and the key is a nice size, easy to handle and also easy to stick on the side of the fridge up high where the kid can't reach.
customer_reviews.author: NYRGirl1985

customer_reviews.title: It takes time but worth it !! Invest in an extra key just in case
customer_reviews.text: We love these because our so was relentless about getting into the cabinets, the install is a bit tricky for what I saw my husband dealing with. He said they hav to be lined up perfectly or the latch won't catch & dear little toddler can pull hard enough to open them without the key!! So once he got the hang of it, went smoother & quicker with only a few having to be redone with the drawers being much harder. The more shallow drawers were harder & the lock takes up a bit of space but totally worth keeping little hands out !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Chill

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These work well - They don't show or damage the face of the doors or drawers. I had been concerned about the magnet being strong enough to unlock the lock through the wood face. Especially drawers built as a box with the face added which makes the face thicker and moves the lock further from the magnet. The magnet is strong enough to work reliably. The locks can easily be disabled when the little ones are not around. Others have posted their concerns about installation. It took me a few minutes to get them mounted and adjusted properly but it is not that difficult after getting the first one installed.
customer_reviews.author: One old guy

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with how these locks work - they're much sturdier ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with how these locks work - they're much sturdier than some of the other locking systems on the market. However, I found them difficult to install, even with the instructions and templates provided. I ended up giving up on the templates after my pilot holes didn't match up and just marking the holes with a pencil using the pieces themselves. I also am not sure why the holes on the locking portion are oval-shaped. We have a few that slide up and down as a result, which causes them not to lock in place every time. I would buy these again, because I think they're better than most other alternatives, but they're not a perfect design.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Dont overthink it.
customer_reviews.text: You think you want these. They seem like a good idea. You don't. Just get the ones that hook on the inside of the door that you press to release. Having to look around your kitchen for a magnetic key every time you want to open a door is obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: A. Timmons

customer_reviews.title: These are the best childlocks, really
customer_reviews.text: Grandparents take note, you will love these locks on your cabinets to keep your visiting grandchildren safe. We have a huge extended family and all of us trust this product. I give these locks to all of my new grandparent friends and to the new babies I send a gift to. Best features: Durability- excellent after 10 years of use. Safety- Even your most clever child will not be able to open this lock. Convenience - You can click the lock off and on easily INSIDE the cabinet. This is great for homes that only need child safety sometimes. Aesthetics - Your beautiful cabinets will look the same. The locks are only on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Misses on Functionality
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy and straightforward to install. The only reason I am giving a 3/5 star is because several of the magnetic wedges get "stuck" down, which in my mind is a safety flaw. And yes I did confirm the switch was in the correct position. After a few uses it stays down and needs rattled before popping back up. I could foresee someone closing a cabinet and thinking it was locked when it actually is not.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I love how these locks keep little fingers and arms out of my cabinets!
customer_reviews.text: I don't really LOVE these locks as indicated by the 5 stars...because any lock you have to add to your cabinets is a hinderance, but I DO love how they keep inquisitive little ones from opening cabinet doors and dragging everything out the minute I turn my back! I bought two sets and my husband installed them on all of our kitchen cabinet doors. It is a relief knowing my grandson can't get into everything in the kitchen and drag out pots and pans or get to household cleaning supplies that I haveunder the kitchen sink. They work well and do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: SWard

customer_reviews.title: What good is a safety lock if it does not lock safely?
customer_reviews.text: We've had these installed in our kitchen for a while and loved them, until the one under the sink (where the cleaning supplies are stored) stopped locking. We only figured it out when our toddler opened the door by himself without the magnet. Since we're past 90 days Safety 1st doesn't care. Stick with a mechanical lock if you care about safety.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus made a better Prime than Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Inferior in every way other than visual profile
customer_reviews.text: Installed these after baby #1 and have had for over a year. Pros: 1) Invisible 2) It's functional Cons: 1) You will loose the magnet and have to buy new ones. We bought plain old magnets at walmart as a replacement. 2) Aligning the magnets to open the cabinet is it or miss. 3) Installing the device is a pain. 4) They are overall just a way bigger hassle than the new ones we bought -
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Muela

customer_reviews.title: Magnet not strong enough through kitchen drawers
customer_reviews.text: Initially upon inspection, everything was as described. The magnet worked well. Unfortunately upon installing, the magnet was not strong enough to get through my kitchen drawers. I also wanted to install on a dresser in the toddlers room and the magnet worked however when lining the device up on the drawer so that it was high enough to catch the bracket, the holes for the screws on the magnet piece were way too high and there was no way to attach it unless I were to attempt a command strip and pray that it stayed. We are opting to return because I have heathens that would RIP right through that command strip.
customer_reviews.author: john youngberg

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for our very active child who loves getting into the cupboards. I decided not to use them on the tupperware cabinet since it makes him so happy to dig around in there. These are best for cabinets you don't need to access nonstop but want to make sure baby can't get in, like cleaning chemicals, entertainment center drawers, things that are holding fragile items, etc. I find that having to grab the magnet key all the time is irritating for things you need all the time. But, these locks work awesome, very sturdy, very secure. As for ease of installation you'd have to ask my husband I didn't do that :D
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Great Child Safety Lock - Takes Some Getting Used To
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews said these were hard to install, but I didn't find them too difficult. I winged it and just used common sense. The best part about these child safety locks are that there is no give to the cabinet door like other latches. They are perfect for anywhere chemicals are stored, but would be annoying on any cabinet you use multiple times a day. The worst thing about these child safety locks is that you have to use the magnet to open them. Initially you forget and then try to remember where you stored the magnet. Fortunately, you eventually get a little more used to it. Quality product so far.
customer_reviews.author: KBoggle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Easy to turn off too when not needed at times.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I keep the magnet key on my fridge for convenient storage & so it doesn't get misplaced on counter or shelf. Easy to use & has a switch on lock that you can turn off anytime so you don't need to use key. Great for babysitters who don't have kids of their own that are toddlers, but need for their babysitting job, or grandparents who have their grandkids come visit. (Because other locking systems always remain locked until you take it off cabinets) You have to screw in locks though, so if you're not handy with tools, get a carpenter to put in for you. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Keeps everyone out of the cabinets! Everyone!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanna lock yourself out of the snacks cabinet or adult drinks? This will do it if your kid hides the key under the dishwasher! Seriously thought, they are a bit of a pain to install but they work great. The unlock feature is nice when cooking so you don't have to constantly be unlocking them!
customer_reviews.author: techieteacher

customer_reviews.title: Love the magnetic vs the older type!
customer_reviews.text: One latch was defective and would not automatically move back to the lock position. Upon contacting the manufacturer, they immediately sent us a starter pack of two locks and one key. Great customer service! We originally were having problems unlocking some installed latches. Ours are installed so that the doors stay so tightly closed, the baby can't rattle the doors. We also have foam bumpers to keep the doors from being so noisy when closing. We finally discovered that pushing in on the cabinet door, when using the key results in the latches immediately unlatching.
customer_reviews.author: momX3

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: We've used these locks in our kitchen and bathrooms for over two years now, and they have been wonderful. Look neat, work beautifully, and while toddler now knows the mechanism really well, she still does not have the coordination to apply the key to the right spot and open cabinet door with other hand. I like the capacity to leave them locked/unlocked- at this point I'm leaving them unlocked since she has lost interest in kitchen cabinets, but will start locking them again when baby #2 is old enough. We put small white labels on the outside of the cabinets to help everyone know exactly where to place the magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Cookworm

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: I'm no carpenter but a drill, tape, screw driver and some common sense made installation go smoothly. It does command some time I'll admit but As a mom I appreciate the complexity of this deterrent for my child :) I also like that he cannot open the doors enough even to smash his fingers like with the push down lever type locks. Also really appreciate that it can be left unlocked too as I fly around the kitchen prepping meals for the week on Sunday afternoons. Key does not actually have to touch cabinet just get very very close so doors don't get scratched! While we're discussing aesthetics, love that these locks are not visible!
customer_reviews.author: justme

customer_reviews.title: I used these for puzzle boxes
customer_reviews.text: I used these for puzzle boxes and I have found these to be the most reliable. The sensitivity of these locks is the highest I have found, meaning, the thickness of the wood can be up to 1" thick and I still get a solid response. Also, other than the screws, no holes are needed like other magnetic latches.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Me

customer_reviews.title: No more pinched fingers or broken fingernails!
customer_reviews.text: After renting a house on Airbnb that had these locks, we bought a set for ourselves. They're brilliant - reasonably easy to install thanks to the little stick-on screw guides they include, totally effective and easy to disable. No pinched fingers or broken fingernails, no gap that a toddler can stick her arm through, and no frustration. It did take my husband a day or so to get the hang of where to put the magnet key, but now he totally loves these. I just wish they included more than one key... a minor bummer to have to buy a back-up, but then the original set didn't exactly break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shellen

customer_reviews.title: Nice locking system
customer_reviews.text: These locks are not as easy to install as I had hoped after watching the video. The problem we had was that the great templates that stick to cabinet and then door didn't work until we took off the cabinet bumpers and added more foam tape. Maybe it was just our cabinets that have a catch latch that kept door from sticking enough to second step of template. The magnet key is wonderful, works well. Hope the plastic parts hold up while being used on our RV cabinets as things move and bounce a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Our go to locks
customer_reviews.text: We have this all over our house. They take some Time to install and we had to drill into the cabinets but we like that you can’t see all the baby proofing all over the house. It is kind of a pain to have to find the magnet each time but I think it’s worth it. I like that you can switch the lock off when you want to, great feature!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Thomasson

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Install, Great At Keeping Kids Out
customer_reviews.text: These locks are very easy to install and very effective at keeping kids out. The lock requires a very strong magnet to release (provided). A nice feature is the option to disengage the lock without removing it. So, when I'm cooking, I use this feature to prevent having to unlock a couple cabinets over and over again. I suggest having a couple backup keys in case of loss. A package of these can be purchased. We also discovered that the wall corner next to the window above the sink is lined with metal below the plaster. So we store our magnets there. That way they are never lost and are up out of reach.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Miller

customer_reviews.title: I would Buy Again and Wouldn't Consider Anything Else for Kitchens or Bathrooms
customer_reviews.text: These really are a great product. Once you get the hang of installing a few, you can get them done fairly quickly. The one thing that I wasn't thrilled about was that sometimes, where you need to mount the catch can be much higher than you'd expect making these useless in those circumstances. It's not the fault of the product, it's just something to be aware of. My solution, which I have yet to do, is to cut little pieces of wood, mount them, and then screw in the catches. The bottom line is that I would buy these again and wouldn't consider anything other than this product for kitchens or bathrooms. For a bedroom drawer it's excessive!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent locks!
customer_reviews.text: These locks work very well in keeping our insatiably curious toddler out of cabinets. We've successfully installed them on both regular kitchen cabinets, drawers, and sliding cabinet doors. I like that these are subtle and can be locked open for future use when our toddler is out of her danger phase, and we won't have to deal with constant spring locks (or have to remove them or replace them if we should have more kids). Ordering extra keys is easy and recommended. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: frenchiemikele

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: It's been nearly 3 years and I cannot find fault with these locks! Worked great for my first child, and now for my second. The locks have a disable option for when they're not needed (unlike other products), dont ruin the cabinets in any way (once you screw them in, they stay without putting a stress on the hinges in the manner of the "push-down-lever" style locks that I've tried), and they look great (i.e. you don't see them when the cabinets are shut so the kitchen has a near look). All in all, a great product! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: B P Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Need spacers depending
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. Totally stop a wiley strong toddler. Note that some cabinet doors and drawers are set up that I had to cut up a wooden yardstick to make spacers between the lock and the drawer front or cabinet door because the way it mated with the frame did not let the catch be close enough for the lock to engage.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these. It's such a creative idea BUT it ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. It's such a creative idea BUT it turns out to be very impractical for several reasons: 1) You can't tell if it's looked from the outside. This is extremely annoying and makes for a lot of blind pulling. 2) You can lose the key. Someone in our house (most likely me) threw the key into the trash. We spent 30 minutes one night trying to pick the lock. Epic flaw. 3) Lastly, the major reason I hated these is because: you can't open the cabinet with one hand! I think all parents would agree that everything needs the ability to be done with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps our curious toddler out!
customer_reviews.text: We use these on everything from kitchen and bathroom cabinets to dresser drawers. Our toddler is into everything and these have saved us a huge headache of cleaning up all of the contents of every cabinet and drawer in the house every day. The cabinets were a fairly easy install. The drawers were a different story, but well worth the time to install them. You can't see them from the outside and they are pretty easy to open.
customer_reviews.author: M.W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install with great results!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, great results, and they don't damage the cabinets. I had to install locks on my cabinets to get certified as a foster parent in my county. I was not looking forward to the extra work, cost, or the look of locks on my cabinets. The case worker suggested these and in a day I had them at home and within an hour my son installed them all. I ordered separate keys to keep near the cabinets that now have locks. I think extra keys will be needed, but other than that, the set was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: T.O. Mom

customer_reviews.title: Better than normal child locks but can be annoying.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great. No problems with it. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that it can be a hassle always having to grab the magnet first. The pros are that your child cannot open the door enough to get fingers stuck like the kind you reach in and push down to open. The con like I said is that you always need the magnet. Buy extra magnets so you always have one close by. If you only have 1 magnet for the whole kitchen you will drive yourself crazy always looking for it. I have 2 magnets, one for each side of the kitchen and I have one back up in case one gets lost.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Best locks for kids
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research regarding cabinet locks and these always received excellent reviews. Now that I have them and have installed around 10, I can see why. These come with a stick on mounting template and mount entirely on the inside of the cupboard with 4 screws (2 for the lock and 2 for the latch). The magnetic opener is great, but unless you buy two sets of locks, make sure you buy an extra key (if you lock it in the cupboard you need a high power magnet or another magnetic key to get it open). My son has tried hard to get into these and he can't even come close. Highly reccommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought these years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome-sauce! My first child was held at bay with the latch kind of locks. Those did not do the job for my second toddler and after he got into the cleaning cupboard I knew we needed something stronger to keep his curious mind safer. These are great! They install easily. You can't see them from the outside of your cupboard so the kitchen still looks nice while being baby proof. We keep the "key" (magnet) higher on the refrigerator so it is within reach as needed. You can disable the locks. Great for if you only have kids with you temporarily and don't want you life permanently child proofed.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: YESSSS
customer_reviews.text: Best. Thing. Ever. After constantly fighting my child getting into cabinets, I told the hubs it was time to put on the locks and man what a happier momma. It does take some getting use to using the key but after a little bit, it's like second nature. I highly recommend these over the traditional ones and make sure to grab off Amazon as it is much cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easiest child-proofing I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly out of the box. You do have to do some installation, but even that was pretty quick. I found that the paper guides included didn't work very well for me, but it still wasn't hard to figure it out. We bought this for when our goddaughter and friends' kids are here, so I don't have to worry about them so much. I'd buy again. Once installed, you can easily open the cabinets/drawers, and I love that you can turn off the locking for when the kids are gone. Make sure your cabinets will work with this system - I think you could encounter some setups where this wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Erin E. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: We had 14 cabinet doors that needed to secured from our 12 month old tyrant but didn't want something to ugly up the kitchen cabinets. They took sometime to install but once you figure it out, it was easy to fly through. They work beautifully. The best is hiding the magnet in my hand, knocking on a 'magic spot' and opening the cabinet for the mother in law. Freaking hilarious. Shes still knocking on the 'spot' trying to open the cabinet as I write this. Anyway, I am not a handy man, and installed it fairly easily and the cabinets still look beautiful. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Waxhaw

customer_reviews.title: It has slots on both the lock and the catch which come in handy for fine adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of a pain to install on our full coverage kitchen cabinet doors, but I was able to reason it out and get them to work. The template has double-sided tape which are supposed to be used in stages. I found the second side was very difficult to peel the backing off the tape. I ended up having to do some measuring to line up the actual lock component to work with the stop. It has slots on both the lock and the catch which come in handy for fine adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: The ones that work are great but I had to call customer service to request ...
customer_reviews.text: I received a few duds within my packages. The ones that work are great but I had to call customer service to request replacements because a third of the ones I ordered the locking mechanism didn't work. Even with it placed on "lock" you could pull the cabinet door open. Pretty easy to install. The paper on the guide stickers was really hard to peel off the back. That took longer than installing actually.
customer_reviews.author: Robin R

customer_reviews.title: Works for Us
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love. My husband had the task of finding cabinet locks and he nailed it with these. We do not have knobs on our doors and these are a great childproofing solution for that situation. The locks are not noticeable looking at the cabinet. When we're not using the key, we stick it on our fridge. A couple of minor negatives: I have to take a moment and feel for the lock when unlocking. The more you unlock, the easier this becomes. This also isn't the most intuitive system to visitors. If you are considering using this system somewhere that will involve a lot of first time users, then this may not be the system for you.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMom

customer_reviews.title: Solid product with a bit of a learning curve to installation
customer_reviews.text: There was a bit of a learning curve to installing the Safety 1st Magnetic Locking System easily, but they are great for toddler-proofing our house. They work well throughout the kitchen, on bathroom cupboards, and even our china cabinet. I like the facts that they do not impact the aesthetics of the cabinets, keep doors sturdily closed even when tugged, can be set to "unlock" when we need the cabinet several times but still want the door closed, and can be unlocked using other strong magnets (not just the "key" provided).
customer_reviews.author: stevo629

customer_reviews.title: Baby walking? Buy now!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as your baby starts to walk, you need these. You have no choice. The magnetic ones are good for the most dangerous drawers/cabinets (silverware, knives, chemicals) and the cheapy simple latches are good for the less dangerous drawers. Magnetics would be great all around but money wise you have to prioritize. The only negative thing (besides the high price) is that if they really want in that drawer, a bit of shaking bypasses the mechanism. It takes a year or two for them to figure it out though. So have a couple back ups ready to install. Also splurging for the two pack of the magnet keys is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: JonnyRizzo

customer_reviews.title: Alternative Use: Secret Bookshelf Door Unlocking Mechanism
customer_reviews.text: For an alternative use, use it as a locking/unlocking mechanism for a Secret Bookshelf Door:  These things are genius. I used one with the full extender set included to connect through a solid wood door and embed the magnetic handle into a book to create a book that unlocks a secret door bookshelf. I did have to add a few flat rare earth metal magnets to the handle for additional strength, but works every time! Love this device!
customer_reviews.author: E. Zeitgeist

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Install was pretty simple and fast with the included template. So far I have most of my bottom cabinets in my kitchen setup with these locks. If you don't want it to lock you can manually push the button on the side too keep it unlocked which is a nice feature. I also have it installed in the cabinet of my saltwater aquarium so my son can't mess with the filtration. It works perfect and could see it used for other applications like hidden drawers or wall closets.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: it's a great idea, though from the few drawers I installed ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my drawers but unfortunately they're incompatible - had to return them. That being said, it's a great idea, though from the few drawers I installed it on before returning, I could see myself easily getting annoyed at having to use a key to open. On the flip side, this design reduces the amount of pinched fingers in comparison to the other products out there that require you to open the door/drawer and push a tab down to open.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Fessenden

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, Easy to Install, Foils children.
customer_reviews.text: This product works! Our daughter liked to rearrange our kitchen cabinets, paw through our bathroom cabinets, and help herself to pots and pans at Grandma's. We got these for all three locations-- Grandma loves it because she can turn them off when our daughter isn't there--no need to fight the baby-proofed cabinets when the child isn't in residence. We love it in the master bathroom for the same reason. Downstairs in the kitchen these keep her from moving our canned goods to the middle of the floor. Also-- they'll work with ANY strong magnet, so no need to limit yourself to the little keys it comes with. Get some attractive magnets and stash them around the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kelloggs

customer_reviews.title: These locks are fantastic. We purchased them to make our house a ...
customer_reviews.text: These locks are fantastic. We purchased them to make our house a kid safe zone as part of our foster licensing process. I love that the locks can be disengaged when they are not needed, but quickly and easily engaged when we have kiddos in the house. Installation is a breeze with the included templates. I recommend ordering at least 2 keys just in case one is lost, or if, as in our case, you add a lock at the top and bottom of a cabinet (medicine cabinet) as a 2 point safety lock. The locks are sturdy and seem like they will hold up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ambrosia

customer_reviews.title: he's not lost the key (it's still on the fridge) and it's really easy to open the cabinets
customer_reviews.text: I was a little iffy about these as it only came with one master key and my husband is notorious for loosing things. Keys, chargers, his sunglasses, socks, etc. I figured we'd use it on the cabinets we don't use on a daily basis. Well, after reading the instructions and discovering the key stuck to our fridge, my husband installed it on all the cabinets we use on a daily basis. In the past month, he's not lost the key (it's still on the fridge) and it's really easy to open the cabinets. They were also easy for my husband to install and he was kind of upset I didn't get another set to finish off the lower cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Not awesome, but it still works. Some of the locks fit tighter on the cabinets than others. Was it a user installation error or just the way they are? It's hard to tell. We have to push on some of the cabinets to make sure it's closed and likewise to open it because it gets stuck. I think that the packaging should come with two magnetic keys because one might get lost. We were going to install a few upstairs, but who wants to walk all the way downstairs to grab the key (and vice versa)? Granted, it's just a magnet and one could probably just throw something together to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Good locks
customer_reviews.text: I first got these almost 5 years ago when my son started walking. They work great, but out of the 3 packages we ended up with 2 locks that won't work for some reason. But they are better than the alternatives. I just bought another package because now my cat can open cabinets so now I need to cat proof my house, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: These were the perfect solution to an overly curious 1 year old who ...
customer_reviews.text: These were the perfect solution to an overly curious 1 year old who doesn't understand, "no". ;). They take a little time to install, as you have to drill them into your cabinets. Once installed, nothing is visible from the outside which is great, and not always the case with baby proofing materials. Our little one has done her best to get into cabinets and drawers, and these locks have held up so far. I do wish these came with one more key- but we can always purchase extra. Overall, not the easiest to install, but by far the most effective and well worth the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Sedberry

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lock as long as you keep a good spot for lock. We tied ours to a drawer handle and keep it in the drawer. I love that you can turn the lock on and off for when I need in the trash more frequently and it prevents our strong 18 month old twins from getting in the trash. The ripped through the adhesive ones so fast it was pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Thegreatone86

customer_reviews.title: I now recommend only these to everyone I know with young kids
customer_reviews.text: My youngest son figured out how to open the traditional locks well before his first birthday. I now have these on all my cabinets and drawers, and he still can't get into them (as long as I make sure he can't reach the key). My kid is a very stubborn strong toddler (21 months) and he has been yanking on these for months and they are still going strong. Placement is key to making sure they work correctly though...I did have to take a couple off and install them in a different spot to make them work the way I wanted. I now recommend only these to everyone I know with young kids.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and good value
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea and very functional. Only 4 stars because they require tools and installation with hardware. Pros: Good value with 8 sets of magnets. The other set of magnets I have found only has four magnets for close to the same price. Cons: Requires someone handy with tools to install. I gave this set to my daughter whose husband might find time to install them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent safety feature. I bought more!
customer_reviews.text: These are my absolute favorite. Perfect for my cupboard doors. I love them. I started with them in the kitchen but have put them throughout my entire house. I have 2 curious toddlers and these are better than the prong hook-like ones I have had previously.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Pros: Keeps my toddler out of the cabinets and drawers. He is now 17 months old and has given up trying to open cabinets. - Easy enough to install, Strong, solid. - They just work. Cons: Kind of bulky for drawers. -Magnet prone to losing or misplacing. Other thoughts: We attached the magnet to our refrigerator for safe keeping but find ourselves misplacing it every now and then. Highly recommend this product. We purchased 2 sets of these and they do everything we want, need and expect it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are some of the best cabinet locks around
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best cabinet locks around. It does take some getting used to, remembering to grab the magnet key before trying to open the cupboards in the kitchen. We keep our magnet key on the fridge so we don't lose it. We did have some difficulty installing the locks and couldn't really figure out the stickers that are supposed to help with positioning. But, we eventually got them installed and they definitely do the job -- until our baby can reach the top of the fridge, he's not getting inside these cabinets!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Works awesomely on cabinets--probably the best out there
customer_reviews.text: Works awesomely on cabinets--probably the best out there...but... Works AWFULLY on drawers--takes up tons of drawer space and my drawers they won't shut all the way with the locks installed. They are probably designed for thin drawers faces and not the custom cabinets/drawers in my kitchen because the plastic bumps the drawer face no matter how I install them, so then the drawer will not close. I took them off my drawers and like them on my cabinets. If they can come up with a better recessed design for drawers, I would be happy to try them again.
customer_reviews.author: TexAg

customer_reviews.title: Magentic locks - very useful
customer_reviews.text: This locks are very useful. I got them when my son was around 18 months and started to pull the kitchen cabinets. they are holding up very well the option to disable them during busy hours comes very handy. Since them I bought a second set and expanded them to drawers as well. It is reliable and does it job well so far. The only down side is we misplacing the key somewhere and so far we have always found it. Given that I bought a second set we have 2 keys now and this works with regular magnets as well. I have used speaker magnets to open it when the key was misplaced.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: I love these cabinet locks
customer_reviews.text: These are so cool. They easily installed- though my husband is quite handy. The concept is great. I love that I don't have to fiddle with a latch down low when I am just wanting to get in and out quickly. Also, the latch type can be a bit difficult to shut sometimes they are very tight. I also love how the cabinet doesn't open at all like the latch type. The magnet is incredibly strong and there is no gap to catch invasive little baby fingers in. I love these. Can't say enough good things about them! They have made life with my curious 14 month old less stressful!
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! Someone recommended them to us and we decided ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Someone recommended them to us and we decided to give them a go! It's nice that they stay shut until u need to open the door, unlike other safety cabinet hooks where the baby can still open it a little and get their fingers jammed inside. I like how it has the feature where u can keep it open and then flip the switch and it's closed for good! It would be nice if they had two keys tho just I case we lose one. But so far so good! We just keep ours on the fridge since its magnetic!
customer_reviews.author: Family of Five

customer_reviews.title: Glorious Creation
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Sent down from the gods to keep my 2 year old out of all my cabinets. My house went from looking like it had been robbed by thieves or ransacked by hungry bears to looking like it belongs on the cover of Better Homes. I'm grateful to the creator of these magnificent little magnet locks. Thank you.... THANK YOU.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny P

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: These are a little difficult to install at first. Definitely need to use the guide and it gets easier after the first few. My 18 month old figured out where to put the magnet and then pull the door open after watching us do it. so make sure you put the magnet somewhere where the baby can't get it. Otherwise they work great!
customer_reviews.author: satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Good locks, bought 2 more packs
customer_reviews.text: Just installed a pack of these. Didn't really use the provided templates - was easy to line up as all the cabinets I installed on have two doors (so I could have one door open while aligning the other door). The screw holes provide some wiggle room for adjustment, so you can fine tune the install. The "key" works well through a standard 3/4" thick door - no need to perfectly align. I like the "on/off" button too so you can easily disable them when you don't need them. Bought two more packs of 8 to do the rest of the cabinets in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

product_meta.title: Safety 1st Magnetic Locking System (1 Key and 8 Locks)
product_meta.description: Make your home a safer place for your child to play in and explore with the Safety 1st Magnetic Locking System. Make drawers and cabinet doors off-limits for your curious child with these locks that open with a magnetic key that's easy to store out of their reach. Installing discreetly inside of your cabinets and drawers, these locks are invisible from the outside. Unlock the mechanism from the outside by placing the magnetic key on the door or drawer on the other side of the lock. The SecureTech indicator on the side of the lock lets you know when the lock is properly engaged again. Disengage the lock with a press of a button when it's not in use. This nine-piece set includes eight locks and one magnetic key, along with installation templates and hardware. Tools are required for installation.
feature_bullets: Keep cabinets & drawers off limits: Peace of mind for parents while children are exploring in the home
Toddler tested. Proven stronger; Locks outperform the competition both in home and mechanical pull force lab testing
Invisible from the outside: Installs inside of your cabinets and drawers, concealed from children and guests
Unlock mode: Option to keep the lock in "Unlock mode" when you need more frequent access to your cabinets
9 piece set: Includes eight locks and one magnetic key, along with installation templates and hardware; Tools are required for installation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,811 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
